first two mc sts together using cc resulting in one cc st on the right needle then continue in *2 mc 2 cc checkerboard pattern until two sts before next marker ssk two cc sts together with a mc yarn resulting in one mc st on right needle slip marker repeat the sequence above five more times until you reach the bor you should have decreased 12 sts and now have 60 sts on your needles around each marker there should be 1 mc and 1 cc decrease row 6 knit the pattern with cc sts over cc and mc sts over mc the checkerboard pattern has been broken around the six markers with just one of each color on either side this will be corrected in the next row all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free 2024kristina k miller intended for individual home use only not to be reproduced or reknit for profit decrease row 7 note there is a color change on this row knit the first two cc/mc sts together with cc yarn resulting in one cc st next knit one cc st you now have two cc sts on the right needle then continue in *2 mc 2cc checkerboard pattern until three sts before next marker knit one mc st and then ssk next two mc/cc sts with mc yarn now you have two mc st that pair together slip marker repeat this sequence five more times until you reach the bor you should have decreased another 12 sts and now have 48 sts on your needles the checkerboard pattern has now been reset and alternates with 2 cc sts and 2 mc sts decrease row 8 knit in checkerboard pattern with cc sts over cc and mc sts over mc repeat decrease row 1-4 one more time there should be only 24 sts remaining with the mc yarn only k2tog all the way around resulting in 12 sts finishing cut mc and cc yarn leaving about a 12 tail of each thread mc tail onto yarn needle and slip through the remaining 12 stitches on needles one or two times slip off needles and pull snug slip tail through center hole this will be used later to attach pompom or button weave in any other loose threads block using your
